byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor reported from Charlotte, and Alan Blinder from Gastonia, N.C. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York, and Richard Fausset from Charlotte.
byline.original: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: People who knew Keith L Scott, black man shot and killed by black police officer in Charlotte, NC, says he worked hard and was family man; police offer different viewpoint, saying Scott brandished gun at scene, ignoring orders to drop it, and note he had spent several years in prison on varied criminal charges.
lead_paragraph: Those who knew Mr. Scott, a father of seven, present a different picture from the one presented by the police.
snippet: Those who knew Mr. Scott, a father of seven, present a different picture from the one presented by the police....

headline.main: Shooting Victim Keith L. Scott Lived Sometimes Troubled but Quiet Life
headline.print_headline: Victim Portrayed as Family Man With a Sometimes Troubled Life
